CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 6, 1958, pg. 2 reads: "Parents Accompany Youngsters - Although many parents still are protesting in an effort to make the School Board furnish bus transportation to school, they turned out en masse to escort their children to the reopened Bennett School, Tuesday morning, and formed a king-sized traffic jam of people and automobiles in front of the school. The confusion necessitated the presence of seven police officers. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Large group of men and women, escorting children to the newly re-opened Bennett Public School
